name: UIAutomation
description: Very limited options for automating a WPF windows tool.

name: WebDriver
description: Best suited for Web Based applications as it supports multiple languages and also there is good community support

name: Cucumber
description: For obvious reasons of a good BDD framework

name: Honeydew
description: Android automation powered by UIAutomator, which unlike robotium-based calabash, allows to cut across app boundries

name: Ruby
description: Very efficient language for writing automation

name: stubby4j
description: Test on UI layer with stubbed services.

name: Cuke_sniffer
description: Cucumber test code analysis

name: Capypage
description: Easy assertion of elements

name: Cuke
description: Good reporting

name: Capybara
description: Abstraction layer is nice

name: Jmeter
description: Very efficient load generation

name: Calabash-iOS & Calabash-android
description: Very good hybrid app automation support

name: Frank
description: Calabash-ios is going to be a plugin for Frank bcos of its more cooler features like browser UI inspector (Symbiote) etc.

name: Flay gem
description: Light-weight and very fast ruby code inspection to indicate code duplication

name: White
description: White, which is a wrapper around UIAutomation does not expose the UIAutomation object which causes difficulty in identifying some custom elements in the Application

name: Odata
description: Using Odata, odata_ruby for accessing MSSQL db

name: Gatling
description: No.of requests can be send from one instance, Good reporting

name: Appium
description: New cool kid to the school which has libraries across languages (Java, ruby etc) and has both native and hybrid mobile app support!! Promises advanced gesture support too.

name: PetaPoco
description: micro-ORM for .NET which reduces lot of effort.

name: SQLMetal
description: Utitlity to create Data Models from DB.

name: GhostDriver
description: Phantom.Js based Webdriver wrapper

name: Site-prism
description: Assertions provided are different from default capybara provided assertions, and so are inefficient

name: Powershell
description: Shell equivalent for Windows. Helps write small snippets of build related tasks

name: Developers writing happy-path automation
description: Minimum coverage assured, which helps a lot during regression, or in other words, reduce regression cycle to the minimum, say couple of hours being max.Also, with developers sharing the code base, code refactorings happen more often which benefits us as a learning curve
